# R Weekly 2024-W15

[Read on the Web](https://rweekly.org/2024-W15.html)

## Highlights

This week we have some great new packages and updates.

+ [Shiny 1.8.0](https://www.rstudio.com/blog/shiny-1-8-0/) - Major update to Shiny framework

## New Packages

+ [{epiCleanr} 0.1.0](https://cran.r-project.org/package=epiCleanr) - Clean and standardize epidemiological data for analysis.

+ [{spatialTools} 0.2.0](https://github.com/example/spatialTools) - Tools for spatial analysis and mapping in R.

+ [{mlHelper} 1.0.0](https://cran.r-project.org/package=mlHelper): Machine learning utilities and helper functions for model development.

+ [{vizExtra} 0.5.0](https://example.com/vizExtra) - Additional visualization tools for ggplot2.

## Updated Packages

+ [{dplyr} 1.1.4](https://cran.r-project.org/package=dplyr) - A grammar of data manipulation.

+ [{ggplot2} 3.5.0](https://cran.r-project.org/package=ggplot2) - Create elegant data visualizations using the Grammar of Graphics.

+ [{tidyr} 1.3.1](https://cran.r-project.org/package=tidyr): Tidy messy data with various tidying functions.

## Resources

+ [R for Data Science (2e)](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/) - Updated edition now available online

+ [Mastering Shiny](https://mastering-shiny.org/) - Online book for building Shiny apps

## Tutorials

+ [Getting Started with Quarto](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/) - Introduction to Quarto publishing

## Call for Participation

+ [useR! 2024](https://user2024.r-project.org/) - Submit your abstracts by April 30

## Upcoming Events

+ [rstudio::conf(2024)](https://posit.co/conference/) - August 12-14, Seattle

## This week's quote

> "In God we trust. All others must bring data." - W. Edwards Deming
